ListCompetitions(MarketFilter, string?)

Returns a list of Competitions (i.e., World Cup 2013) associated with the markets selected by the MarketFilter. Currently only Football markets have an associated competition.

public Task<IReadOnlyList<CompetitionResult>> ListCompetitions(MarketFilter marketFilter, string? locale = null)

Parameters

marketFilter MarketFilter

The filter to select desired markets. All markets that match the criteria in the filter are selected.

locale string

The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

Returns

Task<IReadOnlyList<CompetitionResult>>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a list of CompetitionResult.

ListCurrentOrders(IList<string>?, IList<string>?, OrderProjectionEnum?, TimeRange?, TimeRange?, OrderByEnum?, SortDirEnum?, int?, int?)

Returns a list of your current orders. Optionally you can filter and sort your current orders using the various parameters, setting none of the parameters will return all of your current orders up to a maximum of 1000 bets, ordered BY_BET and sorted EARLIEST_TO_LATEST.

To retrieve more than 1000 orders, you need to make use of the fromRecord and recordCount parameters.

public Task<CurrentOrderSummaryReport> ListCurrentOrders(IList<string>? betIds = null, IList<string>? marketIds = null, OrderProjectionEnum? orderProjection = null, TimeRange? placedDateRange = null, TimeRange? dateRange = null, OrderByEnum? orderBy = null, SortDirEnum? sortDir = null, int? fromRecord = null, int? recordCount = null)

Parameters

betIds IList<string>

Optional list of bet IDs to filter by.

marketIds IList<string>

Optional list of market IDs to filter by.

orderProjection OrderProjectionEnum?

Optional projection type for the orders.

placedDateRange TimeRange

Optional date range to filter by placement date.

dateRange TimeRange

Optional general date range to filter by.

orderBy OrderByEnum?

Optional order by criteria.

sortDir SortDirEnum?

Optional sort direction.

fromRecord int?

Optional starting record for pagination.

recordCount int?

Optional count of records to return for pagination.

Returns

Task<CurrentOrderSummaryReport>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a CurrentOrderSummaryReport.

ListMarketBook(IEnumerable<string>, PriceProjection?, OrderProjectionEnum?, MatchProjectionEnum?, bool, bool, IList<string>?, string?, string?, DateTime?, IList<string>?)

Returns a list of dynamic data about markets. Dynamic data includes prices, the status of the market, the status of selections, the traded volume, and the status of any orders you have placed in the market.

public Task<IReadOnlyList<MarketBook>> ListMarketBook(IEnumerable<string> marketIds, PriceProjection? priceProjection = null, OrderProjectionEnum? orderProjection = null, MatchProjectionEnum? matchProjection = null, bool includeOverallPosition = false, bool partitionMatchedByStrategyRef = false, IList<string>? customerStrategyRefs = null, string? currencyCode = null, string? locale = null, DateTime? matchedSince = null, IList<string>? betIds = null)

Parameters

marketIds IEnumerable<string>

One or more market ids. The number of markets returned depends on the amount of data you request via the price projection.

priceProjection PriceProjection

The projection of price data you want to receive in the response.

orderProjection OrderProjectionEnum?

The orders you want to receive in the response.

matchProjection MatchProjectionEnum?

If you ask for orders, specifies the representation of matches.

includeOverallPosition bool

If you ask for orders, returns matches for each selection. Defaults to true if unspecified.

partitionMatchedByStrategyRef bool

If you ask for orders, returns the breakdown of matches by strategy for each selection.

customerStrategyRefs IList<string>

If you ask for orders, restricts the results to orders matching any of the specified set of customer defined strategies. Also filters which matches by strategy for selections are returned, if partitionMatchedByStrategyRef is true.

currencyCode string

A Betfair standard currency code. If not specified, the default currency code is used.

locale string

The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

matchedSince DateTime?

If you ask for orders, restricts the results to orders that have at least one fragment matched since the specified date(all matched fragments of such an order will be returned even if some were matched before the specified date). All EXECUTABLE orders will be returned regardless of matched date.

betIds IList<string>

If you ask for orders, restricts the results to orders with the specified bet IDs. Omitting this parameter means that all bets will be included in the response. A maximum of 250 betId's can be provided at a time.

Returns

Task<IReadOnlyList<MarketBook>>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a BetfairServerResponse<T> containing the list of MarketBook.

ListMarketCatalogue(MarketFilter, IList<MarketProjectionEnum>?, MarketSortEnum?, int, string?)

Returns a list of information about published (ACTIVE/SUSPENDED) markets that does not change (or changes very rarely). Use listMarketCatalogue to retrieve the name of the market, the names of selections and other information about markets.

Market Data Request Limits apply to requests made to listMarketCatalogue.

listMarketCatalogue does not return markets that are CLOSED.

public Task<IReadOnlyList<MarketCatalogue>> ListMarketCatalogue(MarketFilter marketFilter, IList<MarketProjectionEnum>? marketProjections = null, MarketSortEnum? sort = null, int maxResults = 1, string? locale = null)

Parameters

marketFilter MarketFilter

The filter to select desired markets. All markets that match the criteria in the filter are selected.

marketProjections IList<MarketProjectionEnum>

The type and amount of data returned about the market.

sort MarketSortEnum?

The order of the results. Will default to RANK if not passed. RANK is an assigned priority that is determined by Betfair's Market Operations team. A result's overall rank is derived from the ranking given to the following attributes for the result: EventType, Competition, StartTime, MarketType, MarketId

maxResults int

limit on the total number of results returned, must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1000

locale string

The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

Returns

Task<IReadOnlyList<MarketCatalogue>>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a BetfairServerResponse<T> containing the list of MarketCatalogue.

ListMarketProfitAndLoss(IList<string>, bool, bool, bool)

Retrieve profit and loss for a given list of OPEN markets. The values are calculated using matched bets and optionally settled bets.

Only odds (MarketBettingType = ODDS) markets are implemented, markets of other types are silently ignored.

public Task<IReadOnlyList<MarketProfitAndLoss>> ListMarketProfitAndLoss(IList<string> marketIds, bool includeSettledBets = false, bool includeBsbBets = false, bool netOfCommission = false)

Parameters

marketIds IList<string>

List of markets to calculate profit and loss

includeSettledBets bool

Option to include settled bets (partially settled markets only). Defaults to false if not specified.

includeBsbBets bool

Option to include BSP bets. Defaults to false if not specified.

netOfCommission bool

Option to return profit and loss net of users current commission rate for this market including any special tariffs.

Returns

Task<IReadOnlyList<MarketProfitAndLoss>>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a BetfairServerResponse<T> containing the list of MarketProfitAndLoss.

ListRunnerBook(string, string, double?, PriceProjection?, OrderProjectionEnum?, MatchProjectionEnum?, bool, bool, IList<string>?, string?, string?, DateTime?, IList<string>?)

Returns a list of dynamic data about a market and a specified runner. Dynamic data includes prices, the status of the market, the status of selections, the traded volume, and the status of any orders you have placed in the market.

public Task<MarketBook> ListRunnerBook(string marketId, string selectionId, double? handicap = null, PriceProjection? priceProjection = null, OrderProjectionEnum? orderProjection = null, MatchProjectionEnum? matchProjection = null, bool includeOverallPostion = false, bool partitionMatchByStrategyRef = false, IList<string>? customerStrategyRef = null, string? currencyCode = null, string? locale = null, DateTime? matchedSince = null, IList<string>? betIds = null)

Parameters

marketId string

The unique id for the market.

selectionId string

The unique id for the selection in the market.

handicap double?

The handicap associated with the runner in case of Asian handicap market.

priceProjection PriceProjection

The projection of price data you want to receive in the response.

orderProjection OrderProjectionEnum?

The orders you want to receive in the response.

matchProjection MatchProjectionEnum?

If you ask for orders, specifies the representation of matches.

includeOverallPostion bool

If you ask for orders, returns matches for each selection. Defaults to true if unspecified.

partitionMatchByStrategyRef bool

If you ask for orders, returns the breakdown of matches by strategy for each selection.

customerStrategyRef IList<string>

If you ask for orders, restricts the results to orders matching any of the specified set of customer defined strategies. Also filters which matches by strategy for selections are returned, if partitionMatchedByStrategyRef is true.

currencyCode string

A Betfair standard currency code. If not specified, the default currency code is used.

locale string

The language used for the response. If not specified, the default is returned.

matchedSince DateTime?

If you ask for orders, restricts the results to orders that have at least one fragment matched since the specified date(all matched fragments of such an order will be returned even if some were matched before the specified date). All EXECUTABLE orders will be returned regardless of matched date.

betIds IList<string>

If you ask for orders, restricts the results to orders with the specified bet IDs. Omitting this parameter means that all bets will be included in the response. Please note: A maximum of 250 betId's can be provided at a time.

Returns

Task<MarketBook>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a BetfairServerResponse<T> containing the MarketBook and the RunnerBook for the specified runner.

The granularity of time periods that correspond to markets selected by the market filter.

Returns

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a BetfairServerResponse<T> containing the list of TimeRangeResult.

PlaceOrders(string, IList<PlaceInstruction>, string?, MarketVersion?, string?, bool)

Place new orders into market. Additional bet sizing rules apply to bets placed into the Italian Exchange.

In normal circumstances the placeOrders is an atomic operation.PLEASE NOTE: if the 'Best Execution' features is switched off, placeOrders can return ‘PROCESSED_WITH_ERRORS’ meaning that some bets can be rejected and other placed when submitted in the same PlaceInstruction

public Task<PlaceExecutionReport> PlaceOrders(string marketId, IList<PlaceInstruction> placeInstructions, string? customerRef = null, MarketVersion? marketVersion = null, string? customerStrategyRef = null, bool async = false)

Parameters

marketId string

The market id these orders are to be placed on

placeInstructions IList<PlaceInstruction>

The number of place instructions. The limit of place instructions per request is 200 for the Global Exchange and 50 for the Italian Exchange.

customerRef string

Optional parameter allowing the client to pass a unique string (up to 32 chars) that is used to de-dupe mistaken re-submissions.
customerRef can contain: upper/lower chars, digits, chars : - . _ + * : ; ~ only. This field does not persist into the placeOrders response/Order Stream API and should not be confused with customerOrderRef, which is separate field that can be sent in the PlaceInstruction.

marketVersion MarketVersion

Optional parameter allowing the client to specify which version of the market the orders should be placed on.If the current market version is higher than that sent on an order, the bet will be lapsed.

customerStrategyRef string

An optional reference customers can use to specify which strategy has sent the order. The reference will be returned on order change messages through the stream API.The string is limited to 15 characters.

async bool

An optional flag (not setting equates to false) which specifies if the orders should be placed asynchronously. Orders can be tracked via the Exchange Stream API or the API-NG by providing a customerOrderRef for each place order. An order's status will be PENDING and no bet ID will be returned.

Returns

Task<PlaceExecutionReport>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a BetfairServerResponse<T> containing the PlaceExecutionReport.

ReplaceOrders(string, IList<ReplaceInstruction>, string?, MarketVersion?, bool)

This operation is logically a bulk cancel followed by a bulk place. The cancel is completed first then the new orders are placed. The new orders will be placed atomically in that they will all be placed or none will be placed.

In the case where the new orders cannot be placed the cancellations will not be rolled back.

public Task<ReplaceExecutionReport> ReplaceOrders(string marketId, IList<ReplaceInstruction> instructions, string? customerRef = null, MarketVersion? marketVersion = null, bool async = false)

Parameters

marketId string

The market id these orders are to be placed on.

instructions IList<ReplaceInstruction>

The number of replace instructions. The limit of replace instructions per request is 60.

customerRef string

Optional parameter allowing the client to pass a unique string (up to 32 chars) that is used to de-dupe mistaken re-submissions.

marketVersion MarketVersion

Optional parameter allowing the client to specify which version of the market the orders should be placed on.If the current market version is higher than that sent on an order, the bet will be lapsed.

async bool

An optional flag (not setting equates to false) which specifies if the orders should be replaced asynchronously. Orders can be tracked via the Exchange Stream API or the API-NG by providing a customerOrderRef for each replace order. Not available for MOC or LOC bets.

Returns

Task<ReplaceExecutionReport>

UpdateOrders(string, IList<UpdateInstruction>, string?)

Update non-exposure changing fields.

public Task<UpdateExecutionReport> UpdateOrders(string marketId, IList<UpdateInstruction> instructions, string? customerRef = null)

The market id these orders are to be placed on.

The number of update instructions. The limit of update instructions per request is 60.

customerRef string

Optional parameter allowing the client to pass a unique string (up to 32 chars) that is used to de-dupe mistaken re-submissions.

Returns

Task<UpdateExecutionReport>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a BetfairServerResponse<T> containing the UpdateExecutionReport.
